title: [K-12] Mobile Augmented Reality (mAR)-Based Course to Improve Adult Learners’ Understanding of Math Concepts

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding basic arithmetic operations and fundamental geometric concepts
context.additional_context: Emphasis on spatial visualization and interactive learning through smartphone-based mAR interfaces, with asynchronous learning activities integrated with LMS.

learning_goals: Learners can explain the structural properties of 3D geometric shapes through an mAR interface with 80% accuracy.

Learners solve 3 math problems (1 each in geometry, algebra, statistics) in AR environments (e.g., GeoGebra AR, Quiver), creating ≤3-minute screencasts per problem. Each video must meet ≥70% rubric criteria: problem-solving strategy explanation (20%), calculation accuracy (30%), AR tool appropriateness (30%), presentation clarity (20%)
Learners can achieve an average score of over 75 points on tasks utilizing mAR simulations in weekly formative assessments.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
